answers.answer: High liver enzymes doesn't always mean your liver is involved, there are other causes for this, from medications to diabetes.  Your doctor is correct in ordering the ultrasound so they can know where else to look for what is causing this.  I know it's all scary, but early intervention is key to staying healthy!  If you don't have the necessary tests done and there is something wrong, eventually your body will force you to have testing and most likely with bad news.  Right now you have the opportunity to nip something in the bud before it gets worse....don't pass this up.  It won't go away just because you ignore it!  I wish you all the best and take care of YOU!

question: Hello,I am 53 and I have just had blood work done in the fallMy enzymes are as follows AST 47 ALT 75 GGT 321(yikes)I admit to drinking 12 drinksof low carb low alcohol beer per week.  I have had gallstones diagnosed 21 years ago when I had an attack that sent me to Emergency.  At that time I had several stones and sludge.  I have lost through diet 160 pounds.  I am scared that I have cirrhosis.  I feel fine otherwise but I am very worried.  Any ideas why this GGT level is so high.  I have not had a drink since October when I got these results.  My family docter wants me to have an unltrasound but I am scared I will be give bad news.  I have a lab form to have my tests re done along with a billiruben test.During the Christmas season when I was eating goodies I notice my liver orgallbladder (not sure) felt sore.  Now that I am back on my normal eating I don'tfeel any further discomfort.
title: Scared Stiff
